    • Method Detail

      • intFromByteArray

        public static int intFromByteArray(byte[] bytes,
                                   int i)
        Parses int from the byte array. Reads 4 bytes starting from i. Might throw exception if array length is less than i + 3.
        Parameters:
        bytes - array to parse it from.
        i - index where to start.
        Returns:
        parsed int.

      • growByteArrayWithOne

        public static byte[] growByteArrayWithOne(byte[] bytes)
        Increases the length of byte array by 1 and copies the old data to the beginning of that new array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - array to increment.
        Returns:
        incremented byte array.

      • getNthBitFromByte

        public static int getNthBitFromByte(int n,
                                    byte input)
        Calculates the n:th bit in the given byte. n = 0 = right most bit n = 7 = left most bit
        Parameters:
        n - number of bit
        input - byte to calculate bits from
        Returns:
        1 or 0

      • putIntegerIntoByteArray

        public static byte[] putIntegerIntoByteArray(byte[] bytes,
                                             int number,
                                             int index)
        Stores integer into byte array and returns it. Might throw exception if bytes length is less than i + 3.
        Parameters:
        bytes - array to store int to.
        number - int to store.
        index - what array index to store it.
        Returns:
        result of the method.

      • arrayCopy

        public static void arrayCopy(byte[] from,
                             int fromIndex,
                             byte[] to,
                             int toIndex,
                             int length)
        Copies the contents of one array into another Since this can be done easily with for loops, I am going to assume that this utility function provided by java platform is ok to use.
        Parameters:
        from - array which to copy from
        fromIndex - index of where to start copying from
        to - array which to copy to
        toIndex - index of where to start copying to
        length - of how many elements to copy
